title: Tracking Issue for Implementing Future for Arc and Rc

labels.name: T-libs-api
labels.description: Relevant to the library API team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: C-tracking-issue
labels.description: Category: A tracking issue for an RFC or an unstable feature.

body:
Feature gate: `#![feature(arc_rc_impl_future)]`

This is a tracking issue for implementing `Future` for `Arc` and `Rc`, much like the `Box` implementation (copied below for convenience), differing where it's only implemented if `Future` is implemented for an immutable reference to the contained type.

```rust
impl<F: ?Sized + Future + Unpin, A: Allocator> Future for Box<F, A>
where
    A: 'static,
{
    type Output = F::Output;

    fn poll(mut self: Pin<&mut Self>, cx: &mut Context<'_>) -> Poll<Self::Output> {
        F::poll(Pin::new(&mut *self), cx)
    }
}
```

### Public API

```rust
impl<'a, F: ?Sized + Unpin + 'a> Future for Arc<F>
where
    &'a F: Future
{
    type Output = F::Output;

    fn poll(mut self: Pin<&mut Self>, cx: &mut Context<'_>) -> Poll<Self::Output> {
        F::poll(Pin::new(&mut &*self), cx)
    }
}
```
